Text: Sigh...

Sherry stops researching the artifact and lets out a
long breath. She is finding it hard to focus on her
work.

Ever since the day she befriended Cid, she has felt
so light-hearted that her feet barely touch the
ground.
Cid did say he was going to see the doctor...

Maybe I can go visit him... That wouldn't be weird,
would it?
He is my friend, after all.

The afternoon sun shines into the lab. No matter what
she does, all Sherry can think about is Cid.

She keeps replaying the time he gave her chocolates,
the way he didn't give up in his match, and the
conversation they had over tea in her mind.

In class, in her research, in bed before she drifts
off to sleep, she is absolutely fixated.
What's gotten into me...
I won't get anything done like this.

Rumor has it that Cid is in a relationship with
Princess Alexia.

Sherry didn't know much about that sort of talk, but
anything that made it over to the Academy of Science
from the Dark Knight side must have some level of
credibility to it.
...Okay, it's decided.
She isn't going to get anything done anyway.
So she decides to go straight to the source.
Mm.
This is so good...
Black is the only way to drink coffee.

Adding all that cream and sugar like some silly sweet
tooth is heresy. Pure heresy.

Then there is a knock. It was Sherry at the door of a
room in the girls' dormitory. This is apparently
where they house a certain student who had
been involved in some trouble.
Who is it?

Sherry Barnett, second-year student from the
Academy of Science.
Oh, Sherry. What can I do for you?
Sorry to barge in on you like this...
Sigh...
Please come in.

Alexia welcomes Sherry into her room. The interior
is spacious with a subdued decor. It is much
larger than a normal dorm room.
Sherry sits on the sofa as prompted.
She was nervous about coming here.

Though she had overcome her nerves through some
nonsensical logic of seniority, being a second-year
student while Alexia is only a first-year student,
when it comes down to it, Alexia is still royalty.

(Maybe this was a bad call... No, I'm an
upperclassman... I must be confident.)

As if by reflex, Sherry dumps copious amounts of
cream and sugar into the coffee Alexia serves her.
O-Oh, is that how everyone does it...?
Huh?
N-No, it's nothing...
Th-This is very good.

Y-You think so...? These are the finest beans from
Mitsugoshi. I'm glad you find the taste agreeable.

Alexia's face looks as if she wants to say that all
Sherry is really tasting is the milk and sugar.

Mistugoshi... Oh, the store that sells that chocolate.
They really are incredible. They're so deliciously
sweet and creamy.
I think I can guess why you came to see me today.
*gasp*
It's about the analysis of the artifact, isn't it?
Um...no.
So...the agenda for the student council election?

The Academy of Science holds theirs on a
different day.
O-Oh, I see... So then, what is it?

Sherry sets her cup down, then begins to speak
falteringly, as if she finds it hard to talk.
The truth is...there's something I want to ask you.
Yes?

W-Well...are you seeing someone?
Like a boy, I mean...
Um...

I mean, are you seeing Cid Kagenou...? Like, are you
currently in a relationship with him...?

Alexia examines Sherry's face, trying to discern her
true intentions. Sherry's gaze keeps wandering,
and her shoulders are tense.

Interpersonal relations are likely not her strong
suit and while she is obviously nervous, the main
purpose behind her question is still unclear.
We broke up.
Alexia's tone is even and calm.
You did?!
What...?!

There is heartfelt relief and happiness in
Sherry's voice. Alexia's cup shakes.

Oh, but I take it that means you were,
in fact, dating?
...We weren't truly in a relationship,

but rather acting as if we were due to
certain circumstances.
What a relief...
Sherry giggles. Alexia's cup shakes once more.
The truth is, Cid and I became friends the other day.
O-Oh, really?

Yes. And that's why I was so curious about how
things stood between the two of you.
Um, is that all you really wanted from me?

Yes! It was keeping me from progressing with my
research. But now that I know you two aren't
dating, I'm truly relieved!
W-Well, I'm glad to hear that.
Alexia sets her cup down with a trembling hand.

Thank you very much! Oh, and thank you for the coffee
as well!

Sherry leaves with a bright smile on her face, the
complete opposite of her expression when she
first arrived.

The sound of something shattering immediately erupts
after Sherry exits the room, but she can't hear it
over the din of her own happiness.
